SEARCH

Class TestUAT2

java.lang.Object
TestUAT2
public class TestUAT2 extends Object

User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for Playlist management, Song management, and Listener actions in the music application.

This class manually executes a sequence of test cases to validate end-user behavior for both Listener and Artist workflows.

  • Constructor Details

    • TestUAT2

      public TestUAT2()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main entry point to execute all User Acceptance Test cases sequentially.

      Each test method is called individually, with console output indicating pass/fail status for easier readability and debugging.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)

    • testCreateMultiplePlaylists

      public void testCreateMultiplePlaylists()
      Test Case 1: Verifies that a listener can successfully create multiple playlists.

      Expected Result: Two playlists are created and stored.

    • testRemovePlaylistSuccess

      public void testRemovePlaylistSuccess()
      Test Case 2: Verifies that a listener can remove an existing playlist successfully.

      Expected Result: Playlist count decreases by one after deletion.

    • testRemovePlaylistFail

      public void testRemovePlaylistFail()
      Test Case 3: Ensures the listener fails gracefully when attempting to remove a playlist that doesn't exist.

      Expected Result: No exception crash; appropriate failure message is handled.

    • testRemoveSongFromPlaylistSuccess

      public void testRemoveSongFromPlaylistSuccess()
      Test Case 4: Verifies that a listener can remove a song from a playlist successfully.

      Expected Result: Playlist song count decreases by one.

    • testRemoveSongFromEmptyPlaylistFail

      public void testRemoveSongFromEmptyPlaylistFail()
      Test Case 5: Ensures that removing a song from an empty playlist fails gracefully.

      Expected Result: An appropriate error message or handled exception is produced.

    • testListenerSystemInteraction

      public void testListenerSystemInteraction()
      Test Case 6: Verifies that a listener can interact with the system by creating a playlist.

      Expected Result: At least one playlist is added to the listener’s collection.

    • testListenerRestrictedAccess

      public void testListenerRestrictedAccess()
      Test Case 7: Ensures listeners are restricted from performing artist-only actions (e.g., adding songs to catalog).

      Expected Result: Access denied message is displayed.

    • testArtistSearchSucceed

      public void testArtistSearchSucceed()
      Test Case 8 (ARTIST_SEARCH_SUCCEED): Ensures that searching by an artist name returns matching songs.

      Expected Result: The song with the specified title is found in the catalog.

    • testArtistSearchFail

      public void testArtistSearchFail()
      Test Case 9 (ARTIST_SEARCH_FAIL): Ensures that searching for a non-existent song returns no results.

      Expected Result: No matching song is found for the artist.

    • testArtistReturnsToDashboard

      public void testArtistReturnsToDashboard()
      Test Case 10 (ARTIST_RETURNS_TO_DASH): Verifies that an artist can add multiple songs and remain in the dashboard without re-login.

      Expected Result: Both uploaded songs appear in the artist’s catalog after returning to dashboard.
